summary: Mary Susan Grimes was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978. These documents detail her employment, annual salary, and gross pay during specific periods. The documents indicate her continued employment with the committee from at least April 1978 through December 1978.
significance: Mary Susan Grimes' significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation, though the specific nature or extent of her role is not detailed in these documents. Her presence on payroll and certification reports confirms her as a staff member during the committee's operations.
